title: Import your data from Notion into AFFiNE
description: In this article, we’ll introduce you how you can import your existing data from Notion into AFFiNE.
md: --- title: Import your data from Notion into AFFiNE author: Christopher Smolak tags: User Guide slug: import-your-data-from-notion-into-affine description: In this article, we’ll introduce you how you can import your existing data from Notion into AFFiNE. created: 2023-06-01 updated: 2024-08-28 layout: blog publish: true --- Maybe you are coming from another app, such as Notion, and have a large workspace of work you don't want to lose. No problem! We want you to be able to enjoy [AFFiNE](https://www.affine.pro/), and take control of your data and track progress- so we have added import support from Notion. There are a few steps that need to be completed so we'll guide you through that now. ## Step1.Exporting from Notion First thing to do is export your data from Notion. * Please make sure you export your Notion files to markdown files. ![mbp--XFJeikiwMBdA2LiyeV-65FzgHO86K3uksQRC-8=](https://app.affine.pro/api/workspaces/qf73AF6vzWphbTJdN7KiX/blobs/mbp--XFJeikiwMBdA2LiyeV-65FzgHO86K3uksQRC-8=.webp) ## Step2.Importing Into AFFiNE The procedure is: * Head to All pages * Import page (from New Page more options) * Select markdown files * Select your Notion `.md` to export file ## The Latest Video Tutorial Please check out this video tutorial to know more. ### Things to bear in mind Not all features are supported one-to-one but we are continuing to improve compatibility. So things like Databases may not export perfectly into AFFiNE. More discussion can be found here: [https://community.affine.pro/c/feature-requests/import-export](https://community.affine.pro/c/feature-requests/import-export) #### **In addition:** AFFiNE is an open source alternative to Notion and Miro. We also have edgeless canvas features that can use and our templates feature will be online soon. For people hesitate to use our cloud service, our open source version is a local first product you can self host it and keep all your files on your computer. Click here to know more: [https://github.com/toeverything/AFFiNE?tab=readme-ov-file](https://github.com/toeverything/AFFiNE?tab=readme-ov-file)
